page.title: 01Lathom, nr Ormskirk, Lancs.
page.content: Lathom is a scattered rural area with about 3,500 inhabitants in the civil parish. It is bounded by Ormskirk, Skelmersdale and Burscough. The R.Tawd and the Liverpool-Leeds Canal flow through the area. Most of the land is undulating and covered by farms. A few people work on the land, some travel to Liverpool or Manchester to work and some are unemployed. Pilkingtons Research Labs. stands out from the scattered farms and cottages. There are some modern houses but most are old dwellings and barns which have been modernised. Buildings of note are Lathom Park Chapel (1500),Blythe Hall (1700),and the west wing of Lathom House (1734), now largely derelict. Amenities include Ormskirk Golf Club, Tawd Vale Scout Camp and Lathom Park CofE Primary School which now has 2 classes and less than 30 on roll.
